TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IRemotingTypeInfo

Docs.summary: Provides type information for an object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this interface to provide custom type information that is carried along with the <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.ObjRef> objects.
## Examples [!code-cpp[Remoting.ObjRef#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.runtime.remotin_7_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[Remoting.ObjRef#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.runtime.remotin_7_1.cs)] [!code-vb[Remoting.ObjRef#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.runtime.remotin_7_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: public bool CanCastTo (Type fromType, object o);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool CanCastTo(class System.Type fromType, object o) cil managed

Docs.param: The object for which to check casting.
Docs.summary: Checks whether the proxy that represents the specified object type can be cast to the type represented by the interface.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The current method is called when an attempt is made to cast a proxy generated from a <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.ObjRef>. This method takes into account the type information carried in the <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.ObjRef>.

Docs.exception: The immediate caller makes the call through a reference to the interface and does not have infrastructure permission.
Docs.permission: for operating with infrastructure code. Demand value: ; Permission value:
